root.text:
Poll for the date of the next meetup:

<https://doodle.com/poll/4sbkyewnykbppuq5>

elements.text: Poll for the date of the next meetup:

text: Any more takers?

elements.text: Any more takers?

text: I should start checking venue availability, there’s actually not long until the proposed dates

elements.text: I should start checking venue availability, there’s actually not long until the proposed dates

text: same place again or are we thinking somewhere different?

elements.text: same place again or are we thinking somewhere different?

text: I’m happy to take suggestions or even for someone else to organise the booking but from the research I did last time I think The Counting House is hard to beat for price

elements.text: I’m happy to take suggestions or even for someone else to organise the booking but from the research I did last time I think The Counting House is hard to beat for price

text: Easy here also, Is that price for booking or :beer:?

elements.text: Easy here also, Is that price for booking or

text: Price for booking. I am too price insensitive to pay attention to how much I pay for :beer:

elements.text: Price for booking. I am too price insensitive to pay attention to how much I pay for

text: ah crap didnt realise you have been covering it, in my head for some reason I just thought as there was enough of us it was just to let them know to reserve space.  Certainly happy to help put some monies towards this time ( and buy you beer all night for the previous times)

elements.text: ah crap didnt realise you have been covering it, in my head for some reason I just thought as there was enough of us it was just to let them know to reserve space.  Certainly happy to help put some monies towards this time ( and buy you beer all night for the previous times)

text: Relax, when I say hard to beat on price I mean it’s been free :joy:

elements.text: Relax, when I say hard to beat on price I mean it’s been free

text: haha okay, you had me feeling bad there for a second

elements.text: haha okay, you had me feeling bad there for a second

text: Maybe we can do a poll when everyone who wants to come has confirmed then we can work out best place on average for travel, bank is central I guess, but it may be worth also looking at places like kings cross if or waterloo if everyone is coming from south or north etc (assuming London!). Either way that place in bank has been decent each time so I dont think we can go wrong there again.

elements.text: Maybe we can do a poll when everyone who wants to come has confirmed then we can work out best place on average for travel, bank is central I guess, but it may be worth also looking at places like kings cross if or waterloo if everyone is coming from south or north etc (assuming London!). text: I think I was on the hook for a £100 deposit last time but we're big enough boozers that it was fine

elements.text: I think I was on the hook for a £100 deposit last time but we're big enough boozers that it was fine

text: I assume a few of the guys from betangel will join once dates are confirmed also

elements.text: I assume a few of the guys from betangel will join once dates are confirmed also

text: From my research we basically want a room in a pub; other events venues you're going to have to pay a lot just to book the venue. The Counting House is a great choice because it has multiple potential rooms to use which are of a good size. If anyone wants to volunteer to find a venue or recommend one for me to enquire about then they should do so today otherwise I will just contact The Counting House tomorrow

text: <@U02GGCCLTKM> has joined the channel

Hi everyone, Does anyone have a csv file with Betfair team names across multiple sports? Soccer, Basketball, Baseball, American football etc, It will take me time to build this csv though the API so was wondering if anyone has one handy. Thanks

elements.text: Hi everyone, Does anyone have a csv file with Betfair team names across multiple sports? Soccer, Basketball, Baseball, American football etc, It will take me time to build this csv though the API so was wondering if anyone has one handy. Thanks

text: Suppose I am running a backtest using my own recorded data. If I only want to allow it to call process_market_book once a second, what would be the preferred way of doing it?

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text: Suppose I am running a backtest using my own recorded data. If I only want to allow it to call process_market_book once a second, what would be the preferred way of doing it?

text: I don’t use flumine, but I always use the timestamp on the most recent message I received from BetFair as the current time, so all my logic around comparing times should be the same in a backtest as it is live.

elements.text: I don’t use flumine, but I always use the timestamp on the most recent message I received from BetFair as the current time, so all my logic around comparing times should be the same in a backtest as it is live.
